text.p: Following are some of the main stories in Dutch newspapers today. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
FINANCIEELE DAGBLAD
- Steel concern Hoogovens forecasts strong profits growth in 1997. (p1)
- KLM/Royal Dutch Airlines departing chief's positive statements cause Italian airline Alitalia's shares to soar. (p1)
- Chemicals concern DSM looks in U.S. to expand specialty chemicals division. (p1)
- Papermaker Crown Van Gelder sees profit in first six months of 1997 drop slightly. (p3)
- Rabobank blocks pig farmers' plans to invest in new stalls. (p7)
VOLKSKRANT
- Charter airline Martinair goes to court to demand the raising of ban on Schiphol airport night flights. (p1)
- Bank insurer ING Groep calls for tax collection at the source for the European Union. (p2)
- Dutch Rail NS and building unit Strukton in accord with Volker Wessels Stevin and NBM Amstelland over building activities sale. (p2) -
DE TELEGRAAF
- Insurer Delta Lloyd sees first half net drop 23 pct to Dfl 35.4 million due to storm in June. (p29)
- Belgian Bacob Bank takes over Dutch unit Paribas Nederland from French parent. (p29)
- Catering firm Eurest Nederland introduces fast food in company catering. (p31)
ALGEMEEN DAGBLAD
- Port services concern Hes Beheer books 22.2 mnl guilders loss in first half of 1997, mainly due to extraordinary costs. (p13)
TROUW
- The Netherlands should call for tighter international export rules for raw materials for the pharmaceutical industry, says Wemos society. (p3)
